title: Are we gonna get vs events for other rivals?

replies.body: {{champion:89}} VS {{champion:131}}

Personally, if we do another, I hope we pick Rengo/Jumpbug.

The God Kings were an awesome writing challenge. I'd love to break into Rengo/Jumpbug.

>Jumpbug

I love it.

What other funny nicknames do you have for champs?

(I've heard Stabby Tabby for Rengo)

> [{quoted}](name=Blood Magicks,realm=EUW,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=AKAypPXs,comment-id=000c0005,timestamp=2018-07-04T09:34:58.746+0000)

I call Darius "Large Son" and "Yell Man," and regularly refer to Tahm as Beard Papa

If you don'y mind me asking, how did they feel as a challenge?  I ask because they seem quite "settled", like their (God Kings) roles and foils come very naturally (to Garen/Darius) rather than feeling put-on.

> [{quoted}](name=Larriet,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=AKAypPXs,comment-id=000c000c,timestamp=2018-07-05T03:44:47.062+0000)
>
> If you don'y mind me asking, how did they feel as a challenge?  I ask because they seem quite "settled", like their (God Kings) roles and foils come very naturally (to Garen/Darius) rather than feeling put-on.

Garen was pretty straightforward because he has a very well known, well-worn personality, and a lot of my research was focused on mixing in creator deities from ancient religions (jealous, angry, weirdly insecure). He actually wasn't too tough.

_Darius_ went through multiple iterations because a lot of the material we've published on him paints him in different lights, so I had to do a lot of experimenting to take him to an interesting place while preserving what Darius mains really liked about him. This was in addition to having some narrative parity when laning against GKG. Garen is such a loud character in game, how to we contrast that in a believable way? 

The Darius script you hear in game is actually the third complete rewrite -- he took some extra care to get to a cool place, but I think it turned out pretty well!

> [{quoted}](name=Carnival Knights,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=AKAypPXs,comment-id=000c000c0000,timestamp=2018-07-05T17:51:22.205+0000)

> Garen was pretty straightforward because he has a very well known, well-worn personality, and a lot of my research was focused on mixing in creator deities from ancient religions (jealous, angry, weirdly insecure). He actually wasn't too tough.
> 
> _Darius_ went through multiple iterations because a lot of the material we've published on him paints him in different lights, so I had to do a lot of experimenting to take him to an interesting place while preserving what Darius mains really liked about him. This was in addition to having some narrative parity when laning against GKG. Garen is such a loud character in game, how to we contrast that in a believable way? 
> 
> The Darius script you hear in game is actually the third complete rewrite -- he took some extra care to get to a cool place, but I think it turned out pretty well!

Who would fight Katarina for the Goddess Queen event? I mean Darius is only going to win due to edgelords. or is the lore already set no matter who wins. I mean you guys HAD to have know people will go on the edgey side the most.

> [{quoted}](name=Solargeo,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=AKAypPXs,comment-id=000c000c00000000,timestamp=2018-07-05T18:27:25.345+0000)

> Who would fight Katarina for the Goddess Queen event? I mean Darius is only going to win due to edgelords. or is the lore already set no matter who wins. I mean you guys HAD to have know people will go on the edgey side the most.

It's not over yet! As I understand it, Garen is very popular in a number of other regions, so it'll be interesting to see if he suddenly mops the floor with wolf boy.

As for Kat, why wouldn't she get paired against her sister? Or adoptive brother? Or Lux? I feel like she's got plenty of on-again-off-again rivals.

> [{quoted}](name=Carnival Knights,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=AKAypPXs,comment-id=000c000c000000000000,timestamp=2018-07-05T20:11:54.176+0000)

So its Global wins i take it for who takes the prize of winner?

My thought was "I think Garen/Katarina would be more interesting", but I guess you'd want them to be characters who are played in the same lane (primarily, no h8 on Darius support ofc).  Coincidentally, all of your examples are also played Mid. :P

After we got Pulsefire Ezreal & Caitlyn for that sweet botlane rivalry, I've been interested in seeing this kind of dynamic between a pair of supports.  I feel like that would be pretty challenging for a VS event, given how (traditionally) they aren't going have those 1v1 moments that are definitely a high point for mains of the featured champs during events.

A glimmer of hope yet persists

So you were the writer for VS?

I spotted a pair of "loading screen tips" about (I assume Classic) Garen and Darius weapons being the weapons used long-ago by the God-Kings. Implying that the evens in the VS storyline are canon for Classic Runeterra? Or what?

> [{quoted}](name=DeathBurs7,realm=EUW,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=AKAypPXs,comment-id=000c000a,timestamp=2018-07-04T17:37:38.061+0000)

> 
> I spotted a pair of "loading screen tips" about (I assume Classic) Garen and Darius weapons being the weapons used long-ago by the God-Kings. Implying that the evens in the VS storyline are canon for Classic Runeterra? Or what?

All the current tips are related to the VS universe only. The God-Kings are only canon in their respective universe, and not the core League universe.

Am I correct in saying that "core" lore is canon to the God-Kings universe, but not the other way around?  Based on interactions, etc..  There are a number of other skins like that (Pentakill, Bilgewater skins, Order of the Lotus, Spirit Guard Udyr).  Although I'm not sure if I should steer away from in-game interactions, because we have things like Star Guardian Jinx making fun of Caitlyn/Vi; seems like those kinds of interactions aren't much a thing except for a few odd jokes (SG Ahri & Urgot interaction; Pulsefire shenanigans).

I just see way more potential for other characters to get VS events, who already have established rivalries (like {{champion:89}} v {{champion:131}} , {{champion:10}} v {{champion:25}} , {{champion:126}} v {{champion:112}} etc. etc), instead of Riot having to make up some story in order to make it make sense for a rivalry between {{champion:99}} and {{champion:55}} , who are both oblivious to eachothers' existance.

{{champion:114}} VS {{champion:24}} But idk if it's still canon after jax's lore changes.
Or maybe {{champion:39}} Vs {{champion:50}} .
Diana vs Leona? Hello?

You make some fair points, but let me adress them one by one.

{{champion:29}} VS {{champion:154}} 
Yes, it is not a confirmed rivalry, in the past Twitch was even considered a friend of Zacs for the longest time (most likely because of their chemtech background and that Zacs lore made him an artificial weapon in the past).

However, Twitch is still listed as a "related champion" in Zacs page on LoL Universe. But it doesn't make sense for them to be friends. 
Zac has high moral standards, thanks to his loving parents, and tries to be a hero in that suffering city. While Twitch is legit planning to kill every human being with poison in Zaun. This doesn't really match well together, in fact, it would make a great rivalry. Twitch could be the main antagonist for hero Zac. 

And keep in mind: With the lore update for Zaun, **Twitchs lore wasn't adressed**. His lore didn't get updated and all we got is that text of someone surviving an attack from him and went crazy because of it. If they expand his lore, making him a rival for Zac would just make perfect sense.

____________________________________

{{champion:164}} VS {{champion:6}} 
We got Camille introduced before Urgots update, making him that creeping evil in the shadows of Zaun. And she seems to be **really** well informed about stuff that is going on in Piltover and Zaun. I think it is kind of unlikely that she doesn't find out about Urgot fairly soon, considering that he even has an own cult following him (the Sons of Ur) and is on a killing spree against chembarons.

Urgot is causing chaos and fear in Zaun, he disturbs the balance which Camille tries to protect. Again, not canon yet, but it would make sense that they have an encounter some day and this would definitely not be a friendly tea party.
But I admit, this is the biggest stretch of my picks.

_________________________________

{{champion:27}} VS {{champion:19}} 
Hell, no, they definitely didn't work together.
You are thinking about Warwicks old lore, which changed with his VGU.
In the updated version, Warwick was once a criminal and got caught by Singed, then transformed in a cruel experiment into the beast we know today (by mixing some animal genes like wolf, fox and bat into his bloody system).

It went so far that Warwick died during the experiment and Singed threw him in the trash as a "fail". But the mixture in his venes resurrected Warwick and since then he is running through the streets of Zaun, trying to kill chembarons and keeping control over the wild animal he has become.

So it is very unlikely that Warwick has any friendly feelings for Singed.

_____________________________

{{champion:36}} VS {{champion:245}} 
Yes, they just met once. But I thought that Dr. Mundos thought of Ekko as "patient zero" is quite interesting and it couldn't hurt to keep this whole thing as a rivalry between them. Dr. Mundo feels extremely isolated in his lore, lacking interactions with other champions. And I think that this one has a great dynamic, they should expand on this.

{{champion:164}} is probably neutral to {{champion:6}} 

She strives to keep piltover in an advancing state and doing any jobs she acquires towards removing problems.

Urgot you'd have to look at and question if he's a problem, cause are chembarons really good? If Camille can go around assassinating people that disrupt piltover, isn't urgot technically doing a similar job? Again this is a matter of whether or not chembaron are considered good or bad guys, I don't recall any good lore about chembarons, just everybody wants to kill them (urgot, warwick, possibly twitch and zac.) and some chembarons have even created their own problems.

I doubt camille would care either, since the reason the chembarons are down there is so they don't pollute and disrupt the progress of piltover and basically turn it into zaun, they're out of her way so until urgot comes up and decides to wreck havoc, which Idk if he's interested in doing (seems just pissed with zaun and noxus), camille probably just has an eye on him at best, if he keeps people in line then he's not making things worse. 

She' probably more concerned with Ekko, since who knows maybe his time traveling can cause some problems. Jinx she's definitely hunting down probably.

Urgot isn't just trying to kill chembarons, he wants to throw Zaun into chaos and anarchy, then most likely continue with Piltover (just look at his quotes, for example that Piltover is just a "parasite").

I highly doubt she would be neutral to him. He is a major threat for the whole city, he even gathers an own cult.
Urgot is a cruel murderer who doesn't discriminate, he kills everyone he can get in his grasp to test them of their worth. 

I think there is absolutely no way that she is neutral to someone who threatens the city that much.
And keep in mind that Zaun and Piltover are intertwined with each other. It's not like Camille doesn't care about the things going on in Zaun, since these oftenly will affect the city above as well. Zaun and Piltover are dependant of each other and she knows that.
We also had GP vs MF.
